Back in the day - my dairy tolerant days, when I could have all the cheese and cream and butter to my heart's content - I LOVED coming here.  Those days are gone.  But I still fondly remember Da Greco - how they'd serve a chunk of parmesan cheese on the table for us to pick at... they'd finish off the risotto in the hollowed-out wheel of said parmesan - swirl it about, and then serve it cooked and seasoned to perfection.  Not only would they serve you a plate of it - they'd place a serving in the center of the table for everyone to try... and then serve a plate to the next table "para probar". What if no one at your table ordered the arrabiata pasta?  but the next table did?  That's right, you'd get a small serving "para probar".  The place looks like an antique shop exploded in the restaurant - with ornate candelabras, fancy framed oil paintings, and statues galore... kinda cluttered if you ask me.But the food was good.  I'd go there again, but it's torture, I tell ya!  Seeing those foods that I used to love that I can no longer have... like the mushroom ravioli... sigh.
